definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To incline , deviate , or bend , from a vertical position ; to be in a position thus inclining or deviating.
examples: She leaned out of the window.

definitions.definition: ( copulative ) To incline in opinion or desire ; to conform in conduct ; often with to , toward , etc.
examples: I’m leaning towards voting Conservative in the next election.

definitions.definition: ( Followed by against , on , or upon ) To rest or rely , for support , comfort , to use as a hard surface for writing, etc.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To incline , deviate , or bend , from a vertical position ; to be in a position thus inclining or deviating.
secondary_definitions: ( copulative ) To incline in opinion or desire ; to conform in conduct ; often with to , toward , etc.
( Followed by against , on , or upon ) To rest or rely , for support , comfort , to use as a hard surface for writing, etc.

definitions.definition: To thin out (a fuel-air mixture): to reduce the fuel flow into the mixture so that there is more air or oxygen.

main_definition: To thin out (a fuel-air mixture): to reduce the fuel flow into the mixture so that there is more air or oxygen.
